comments:
When project contains include path with spaces in it, the include browser and call  hierarchy view doesn't work.

When I try to open call hierarchy, I see window with message:
[An internal error occurred during: "Open Call Hierarchy"]
with buttons "OK" and "Details", however, "Details" button is greyed out.

Include browser shows no include files at all.

When I remove this path from project settings and make reindexing everything is fine, only some include files are marked as not found.

CDT version:
Eclipse C/C++ Development Tools
Version: 4.0.0.200703302000
Build id: 200703302000

Created an attachment (id=63895)
Screenshot demonstrating spaces in folder name

In general spaces in include paths work, see the attached screenshot. To make the bug reproducable, please attach a small project that demonstrates the problem. Please also provide what you find in the log-file of your workspace (<workspace>/.log).

You are right - it seams to be not a problem with space in name.
I have a makefile project and I am using Analog Devices VDSP C/C++ compiler.
It seams that include files from my toolchain contains something, what makes exception in parser.
I will try to find out, what is crashing pareser.

Here is log:
